abstract: The Industrial Designer discussed the necessary internal components and how they operated together, and presented her preferences for the type of each component to be used.
extractive:
Um so I think we need two basic functions which is just the basic remote functions ,
the user can input a channel or volume setting and it will be output to the T V .
And also we talked about um a location function where maybe you could press a button on the T V and it would send sort of signal to the remote where it would beep or flash or vibrate or whatever to tell you where the remote is .
So the components we need are an energy source to power the remote ,
processor to take the information ,
and we also need something on the remote that would receive the location signal and have an output , like possibly a beep or a vibration .
Um so my personal preferences for how to build the remote would probably be uh , battery for the energy source ,
um a button pad for input ,
I R transmitter to communicate to the T V ,
and I'd probably say a buzzer for the location function on the remote itself .
text:

ID: the user can input a channel or volume setting and it will be output to the T V .
ID: And also we talked about um a location function where maybe you could press a button on the T V and it would send sort of signal to the remote where it would beep or flash or vibrate or whatever to tell you where the remote is .
ID: So the components we need are an energy source to power the remote ,
ID: um input which would probably be buttons ,
ID: although um we just talked about voice recognition ,
ID: processor to take the information ,
ID: um something to transmit it to the T V ,
ID: and we also need something on the remote that would receive the location signal and have an output , like possibly a beep or a vibration .
ID: And also you need a sender for location signal ,
ID: which would probably be a separate um thing that we'd have to sell with the remote and people could stick it on their T V or stick it on their wall .
ID: And this is just sort of an overview of how the remote works .
ID: Power comes from the battery , goes to the chip ,
ID: um and then it is sent from there to an infrared bulb
ID: which is probably the easiest way to send to the T V .
ID: And then for the location function , you would have a sender on the T V which would output some sort of signal ,
ID: um we could use I R but we'd probably wanna use radio instead .
ID: That signal would go to a receiver which it would process it ,
ID: and it would be output in the form of a buzzer or a light lighting up .
ID: Um so my personal preferences for how to build the remote would probably be uh , battery for the energy source ,
ID: that way you wouldn't have to plug it in ,
ID: um a button pad for input ,
ID: um we can purchase a pre-made chip which will handle all the processing stuff ,
ID: I R transmitter to communicate to the T V ,
ID: that's just sort of standard , um so most T V s have an I R receiver .
ID: Probably a radio receiver to send out location function and to receive it
ID: and I'd probably say a buzzer for the location function on the remote itself .
